TF035313-BOSNIA & HERZEGOVINA -
            WATER AND SANITATION,TF027097-PHRD-RECONSTRUCTION ASSISTANCE PROJECT,TF020873-RECONSTRUCTION PROGRAM
            PREPARATION (BANK EX.),TF024032-TFBH-WATER SANITATION &
            SOLID WASTE WORK PROJECT

abstracts.cdata!:
For the part of the project financed by
            the World Bank and the Italian government, the overall
            outcome of the project is rated as satisfactory. However,
            the project's overall sustainability is rated as
            unlikely. This is due, in part, to country conditions beyond
            the control of the sector as well as because much of the
            reform agenda still remains to be implemented. Overall, Bank
            performance is adjudged satisfactory although it could have
            been more effective regarding institutional strengthening
            and donor coordination. Similarly, Borrower performance is
            rated as satisfactory. Lessons relevant for other emergency
            reconstruction projects are: Although projects of this type
            tend to focus on the more urgent physical investment
            interventions, their eventual sustainability is affected by
            achieving the necessary institutional and policy
            improvements. Project design should therefore include
            explicit objectives to be achieved in a phased manner,
            including improving the financial state of the utilities and
            strengthening management and operations. The Bank should
            take the lead in seeking and achieving donor coordination
            and consistency in key project matters, including the design
            and implementation of the policy and institutional
            framework. The project's content and impact should be
            assessed conservatively, close to the core of Bank financing
            allocated. Implementation arrangements should build on
            locally available expertise, and expatriate technical
            assistance should be limited.
